subject: p12185775
History: Evaluation of the patient with end-stage renal disease, admitted due to pulmonary edema, currently with fever, nausea and increased oxygen requirement.
Findings: AP radiograph of the chest was reviewed in comparison to. As compared to recent radiographs, there is interval development of right lower lobe opacity that might reflect interval development of atelectasis, potentially complicated by infectious process. There is also pleural effusion demonstrated, new. Left upper lobe calcified granulomas are unchanged.
